title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling the class using ajc -d subpackage subpackage/Test.java, a directory 'subpackage' is created under the existing 'subpackage' directory.
EB: The compiled class should be placed in the existing 'subpackage' directory, without creating a subdirectory with the same name.
SR:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command: ajc -d subpackage subpackage/Test.java
